definition: to do/to make/to go in for/to set up/to get hold of/to take care of

sentences.english: Think Liar Liar with more depth and less wacky.
sentences.chinese: 而《大話王》較有深度而搞怪較少。

sentences.english: Be eccentric now. Don't wait for old age to wear purple.
sentences.chinese: 現在就隨興搞怪，不需要等上了年紀了才穿上紫紅袍。

sentences.english: Think Liar Liar with more depth and less wacky .
sentences.chinese: 而《大話王》較有深度而搞怪較少。

sentences.english: Do strange mahjong desk to let a person remember " Alice somnambulate elfland " setting.
sentences.chinese: 搞怪的麻將桌讓人想起“愛麗絲夢遊仙境”的場景。

sentences.english: LA Times】Beijing — A child’s concentration wanders during class at a school in the suburbs ofBeijing.
sentences.chinese: 北京一所郊區學校，這個孩子在課堂上頻頻搞怪。

sentences.english: British post-war formality was always useful to him.
sentences.chinese: 英國的戰後禮儀都是羅斯搞怪的好素材。

sentences.english: Clowns are comedians who try to make the audience laugh.
sentences.chinese: 可以說，他是個喜劇演員，用搞怪來使人發笑。

sentences.english: But Jolie laughed away at Aniston's jokes.
sentences.chinese: 但茱麗只是笑着看安妮斯頓搞怪。

sentences.english: Bean teddy bear. The funny expression was well drawn and made me laugh.
sentences.chinese: 那逗趣搞怪的表情畫得很好，看得我都忍不住笑了。
伊麗莎白容忍了薩拉的搞怪。

definition: to amuse/to make sb laugh/to tease
to show off/to put on a show to amuse others
to amuse oneself/to clown around/to provoke laughter
silly talk or "mo lei tau" (Cantonese), genre of humor emerging from Hong Kong late in the 20th century
to pull a face/to grimace/to scowl
spoof (web-based genre in PRC, acquiring cult status from 2005, involving humorous, satirical or fantastical videos, photo collections, texts, poems etc)
cannot help laughing/unable to restrain a smile
